name: Drawing Application
desc: Using a combination of variables, images, for loops, animations, conditional statements, text, color, etc. create a “Drawing Application” that uses keyboard and mouse user input. Must include at least one for loop and two conditional statement.

name: JSON Demo - Class Example using Open Notify Astros API
desc: Use p5 to load and use JSON data using Open Notify Astros API.

name: Bubbles Example
desc: Starting from the class example of using arrays, I created a small app that makes bubbles move toward the mouse on click. This is also an example of using the instance mode for p5.js.

name: JSON Arrays Demo - Class Example
desc: Use p5 to load and use JSON data with arrays.

name: JSON Demo - Class Example
desc: Use p5 to load and use JSON data.

name: Class Example for using P5 to Make a Narrative
desc: Example from class for using P5 to create a narrative.

name: OpenWeatherMaps API Demo - Class Example
desc: Use p5 to load and use JSON data from the OpenWeatherMaps API.

name: OpenWeatherMaps Visualization Project
desc: Use OpenWeatherMaps and bike incident data to create a biking dashboard for a given area.

name: Class Example for using P5
desc: Small example of using p5.js. This is also an example of using the instance mode for p5.js.

name: Class Example for using P5 DOM Library
desc: Small example of using the p5 DOM library This is also an example of using p5 loader for loading p5 and its libraries.

name: Web Narrative Project
desc: Using p5, create an interactive narrative web app that uses interactive HTML elements such as sliders, buttons, clicks, text boxes, etc. and CSS styling. This game is a variant of "Hunt the Wumpus"
